byline.contributor: Aurelien Breeden contributed reporting from Paris and Andrew E. Kramer from Dnipropetrovsk, Ukraine.

abstract: Gazprom chief executive Aleksei B Miller warns Ukraine it could run out of natural gas within two days due to payment disagreement; bitter feud over gas payments has been part of wider political dispute between Russia and Ukraine over past year.
lead_paragraph: The head of Gazprom said that Ukraine would use up its prepaid allotment in days and would not be able to pay in time to keep the supply going.

headline.main: Russia Heightens Dispute With Ukraine Over Natural Gas
headline.print_headline: Russia Heightens Dispute With Ukraine Over Natural Gas

snippet: The head of Gazprom said that Ukraine would use up its prepaid allotment in days and would not be able to pay in time to keep the supply going.
